hero.headline: How to Make YouTube Videos Unlisted
hero.subheadline: Share selectively. Control who sees your content.

sections.content: Unlisted videos are visible only to people with the direct link—they don't appear in search, recommendations, or your channel page. Perfect for sharing with specific audiences, client work, or content not ready for public. Here's how to use unlisted videos effectively.

faq.question: Difference between unlisted and private?
faq.answer: Unlisted: anyone with the link can watch. Private: only you and up to 50 invited people (Google accounts). Private requires login, unlisted doesn't. Choose based on security need.

faq.question: Can unlisted videos be found?
faq.answer: Not through YouTube search or recommendations. But if someone shares the link, others can watch. Not truly secure for confidential content. Use private for sensitive material.

faq.question: Do unlisted videos count for channel stats?
faq.answer: Views count toward your total but don't contribute to public metrics visible to others. Watch time counts for YPP requirements. Good for testing content before public release.

faq.question: Can I make public videos unlisted?
faq.answer: Yes—change visibility anytime. Existing links still work. Video disappears from channel page and search. Comments remain. Views already counted remain in stats.
